content.description: Starts with the first two moves of Matt's Roof then instead of throwing to the lip on the left, use the underclings below the lip on the right and then continue right using the lip and holds in the face. Watch out not to hit the boulder behind you.

You get to do the fun opening moves of Matt's Roof, then bust left hand to a big undercling under the roof. Establish on the lip, and with underclings with the right hand, work another 5-6 feet along the lip, through slopers until you find a couple of better holds, and can rock over.

My favorite line on this boulder, though you have to watch your back on the rock as you do the last few moves.
content.protection: Bring 4-5 pads for the lower section, and you'll need a couple of thin ones for the upper traverse.
content.location: Starts on Matt's Roof, make the big left hand throw, traverse under the roof for a few moves, and rock over onto the small hanging slab.

content.description: On the face to the left of Matt's roof. Starts with an obvious left hand crimp and a small 2 finger nub for the RH one very hard move leads to an easier mantle.
content.location: On the face left of Matt's roof

content.description: Begins on positive, opposing flakes under the roof. Follow fingerbuckets to lip and then top out left or straight up.
content.location: In the trees just down canyon from Tequila. You can romp across the talus, following the western edge of the treeline diving talus field from party pit. It's right behind a large vertical face at the south end of the field.
